title: The regiospecific Fischer Indole reaction in choline chloride.2ZnCl[subscript 2] with product isolation by direct sublimation from the ionic liquid
abstract: The Fischer indole synthesis occurs in high yield with one equivalent of the ionic liquid choline chloride·2ZnCl[subscript 2]; exclusive formation of 2,3-disubstituted indoles is observed in the reaction of alkyl methyl ketones, and the products readily sublime directly from the ionic liquid.Peer-reviewedPublisher Versio

The Fischer indole synthesis occurs in high yield with one equivalent of the ionic liquid choline chloride·2ZnCl[subscript 2]; exclusive formation of 2,3-disubstituted indoles is observed in the reaction of alkyl methyl ketones, and the products readily sublime directly from the ionic liquid.</dc:description><dc:description>
